definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
flower/earlobe/fig. item on both sides/classifier for flowers, clouds etc

sentences.english: We all think eating fruit means just buying fruit, cutting it up and popping it into our mouths.
sentences.chinese: 一说吃水果，我们就想到买说过，切成块，大快朵颐。

sentences.english: Others chow down on everything in sight and still stay skinny.
sentences.chinese: 其他人对眼前的任何食物都大快朵颐，可还是很瘦。

sentences.english: He sweated as he watched us gobble down the food.
sentences.chinese: 当他看着我们大快朵颐时都冒汗了。

sentences.english: Serve steamed fish, he carved out shark fin, meet to watch her cheek.
sentences.chinese: 蒸鱼上桌后，他又剔掉鱼刺，满足地看着她大快朵颐。

sentences.english: But don’t use this as an open invitation to pig out.
sentences.chinese: 但不要把这种方法用成放开胃口大快朵颐了。

sentences.english: Have no meat unhappy ready to visit over time?
sentences.chinese: 向来无肉不欢的准备好大快朵颐一番了吗？

sentences.english: The Japanese auto industry was preparing to have Detroit for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 日本的汽车工业准备将底特律大快朵颐。

definition: to chew on a large slab (idiom); a large mouthful is hard to chew/to tuck into a great meal
to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
to move the jaw/to munch/to masticate
to eat one's fill/to be full
lit. to drool with desire (idiom)/fig. to hunger for/greedy
to drool with desire (idiom); to envy/to hunger for
to taste a small amount/to sample
